column5: You're too much   :lol:   Thanks Shore_Lunch!!!   Thanks Doug!!!  The start of the game is from the blue ring where you see 2 arrows pointing in their respective directions, double skunk in the black and yellow as dots and skunk in the red and green rings.  The end is in the red in between the 2 arrows pointing at each other.  Certainly not your traditional looking layout but that's what I was inspired doing when I first started working on the pattern  I don't think I will add any numbers to it but will add some additional touches in the final 10% of this work Will keep you posted on that
Looks great Jacques---also looks like a lot of work---good job
Thanks Terry!!!  Yes it's a lot of work.....  going on day 4 now    and tonight decided to take a break from it.
Great idea!! Looks extreamly good! Cant wait to see the final result!
Thanks troutboy!!!

After seeing such an outstanding performance by our athletes, just could not pass the opportunity to make something in the work shop to honor them..... and had a good idea what I wanted to make.  Here's what I have done so far      About half done Will keep you posted on the development Leechman
you can hang a bunch of baits from that when its done and mounted on a wall   :D  :D

Drill a bunch of holes in it and call it Olympage or Cribbics. Nice scroll saw work (I assume). On a side note Jacques, I have never seen a guy that gets more man time than you. I am not sure how you have managed it, but good on ya! Jim

Now there's an idea      Thanks Tom!!!   Thanks Jim!!!  Used the jigsaw for that one..... just a couple of hours     Now I got some serious sanding to do The idea of drilling a bunch of holes came to mind     but once I'm finished with the sanding part, I will proceed to the next step and..... you'll just have to wait for the final results  Thanks again Jim Jacques
Jacques ....you should make 14 rings together and paint them all gold...NOBODY in the world would understand it but Canadians would
Thanks Twocoda!!!  Too bad it wasn't 15...... cause that would be very possible    would only need to make another 2 of those
im kidding when i say this ....Your not a member of the RLTA are ya ???
I know      and no way hozey
nice!!!
Thanks TJ!!!  Just got 4 hours of sanding done    working on the pattern right now
Way cool
Thanks Joey!!!  I think I need a break..... cause that was a full days work right there Stay tune for the development Leechman
bow down the great craftsmen is amoung us!      awesome work jaques!
Thanks Kev!!!  Wait til you see the end results
A stoopid fish on the other end of a line is a stroke of luck, but that is pure talent, skill and care.  Thanks for sharing that, and keep us up to date, will ya?
Thanks Doug!!!  I promise.... should have some new pics up tomorrow     Stay tuned
...add an eye and three trebles and troll it!
Lew could probably use it for hanging his "boo-tails" off of to dry,    :D  :D
Thanks Dozer!!!  I wonder how well it would do on top water   Here's what I decided to do..... 70% done  The layout    An hour of drilling    Leechman
Another update.....  a couple coats of white    Stay tune on the development Leechman
HMMMM i see myself wearing that as a necklace or something!
You're a funny guy Kev  Here's another update on the project...... 90% done..... enjoy    Leechman
can i wear it as a pimp's neckalce PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE!
Looks good!
Where's the skunk line?  I luvs me some cribbage.  Very nice work.
